preqs: GEN2041 or BMS2042,  MCB2011 or MOL2011

rules.ruleString: Unit was previously coded {GEN3022, GEN3051, GEN3052%}
Unit was previously coded {GEN3022, GEN3051, GEN3052%}
(Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2042, GEN2041} and  Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2011, BMS2021, BMS2031, BMS2052, BMS2062, BTH2732, GEN2052, MOL2%})
Must have passed an (I/W) unit in {BMS2042, GEN2041, MCB2011, MOL2011}

description: The study of genetics and its applications to medicine and forensic biology including genetic disorders, genetic screening and DNA profiling. Topics include cytogenetics, immunogenetics, genetic counselling and gene therapy. The impact and ethics of recent genetic advances on both the individual and society will be discussed. The unit will focus on current techniques in DNA testing both in medical diagnosis and forensic biology. Practical sessions will involve an analysis of human chromosomes and aspects of genetic counselling.
